or any input

People respond badly when I ask this question, but I'll ask i=
t to you: what are you worried will break? Test that thing.

If you think y=
ou might use the JavaMail libraries incorrectly, then I suggest that you do=
 the following, which is a variation on the Golden Master technique.

1. Wr=
ite a small program that sends a simple message to a group of recipients.
2=
. Test it by hand.
3. Look at the low-level JavaMail settings you are using=
 to make it work.
4. Create a class (or a Map) that represents the JavaMail=
 settings. This is the Golden Master.
5. Use the Golden Master data to veri=
fy that you can build the parameter list correctly.
6. Decouple building th=
e JavaMail parameter object from using JavaMail to consume it.
7. Test the =
first; don't test the second.

Take care.
